definition: to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
to settle a bill/to close an account
to settle accounts/to clear accounts/to liquidate/to expose and criticize
let it be/let it pass/forget about it
to calculate/to weigh (pros and cons)/to view as profitable/worthwhile/value for money/cost-effective

sentences.english: Blair: Well, lucky for you, your friend is someone I actually care about.
sentences.chinese: 算你走運，你的那位朋友碰巧是我挺在乎的一個人。

sentences.english: He suggested that tangling fishing gear should be made a criminal offence.
sentences.chinese: 他提議，纏繞捕魚器材應該算刑事犯罪。

sentences.english: Even if not to stay, so grand luxury Memorial also to be a trip.
sentences.chinese: 即使留不住，如此隆重奢華的祭奠也算不虛此行吧。

sentences.english: But if less is more, how you keepin' score?
sentences.chinese: 但如果少就是多，成就該如何算？

sentences.english: Lady in the end how to be beautiful like?
sentences.chinese: 女人到底怎麼樣纔算美麗？

sentences.english: Operators want the most exciting scenes of the small feeding of goldfish .
sentences.chinese: 最爲精彩的要算小金魚喫食的場面了。

sentences.english: Can you help calculate our import duty?
sentences.chinese: 你能幫我們算一下進口稅嗎？

sentences.english: Is there a 'right' amount of money to leave to kids?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲給孩子留多少錢纔算合適？

sentences.english: To work a treadle . Or operate a lathe?
sentences.chinese: 一定要開車牀纔算勞動？

sentences.english: I must wonder how far is too far when venturing into a virtual reality.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道當冒險進入虛擬現實時走多遠纔算可以？

sentences.english: Marshalled by Ferdinand and Wes Brown, however, United's defence rarely creaked under the Latics' pressure.
sentences.chinese: 由於有費迪南德和布朗坐鎮，曼聯的防線還算穩固。

sentences.english: She can be counted as a dancer.

sentences.chinese: 這職員是計時算工資的。

sentences.english: If life's a game, money is how you keep score.
sentences.chinese: 如果生命是一場遊戲，金錢就是你的算分牌。

sentences.english: Now, Honey, they's my parents too.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的，現在，他們也算我爸媽。

sentences.english: Bread and milk is my favorite breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 牛奶和麪包怎麼算一套東西呢？

definition: enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to be worthwhile/to be worth it
as for/as to/to go so far as to
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
at the minimum/at the very least
